bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.summary: wandb crashing with "W&B process failed to launch"
bug.description:
<denchmark-code>wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.log Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 806, in <module> logging_setup() File "/home/ubuntu/log.py", line 39, in logging_setup wandb.init(project=project_name, name=logdir_name, dir=wandb_dir) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 976, in init _init_headless(run) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 258, in _init_headless "W&B process failed to launch, see: {}".format(path)) wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.log </denchmark-code>
Here's the debbug log <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/files/3612330/debug.1.log>debug (1).log</denchmark-link>
One potential weirdness is that I saw it trying to upload data to someone else's account <denchmark-code>https://app.wandb.ai/sokolov-yas/Transformer-XL+source+code/runs/bbecxm7m </denchmark-code>
This is an account of of a person who created an image I'm running. Does wandb login save credentials to disk?

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.98. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Yes, wandb login writes your key to ~/.netrc. That debug log is for a completed run. Most likely the launch failed because of permissions, but I thought we had a better error message in that case.

I had wrong debug.log, actual log is pretty short and looks like this <denchmark-code>2019-09-14 17:47:02,424 DEBUG MainThread:22297 [wandb_config.py:_load_defaults():87] no defaults not found in config-defaults.yaml 2019-09-14 17:47:02,434 DEBUG MainThread:22297 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'cat-file', '--batch-check'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=<valid stream>) 2019-09-14 17:47:02,441 DEBUG MainThread:22297 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'rev-parse', '--show-toplevel'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) 2019-09-14 17:47:02,445 DEBUG MainThread:22297 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'status', '--porcelain', '--untracked-files'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) </denchmark-code>
The python stack trace was <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 845, in <module> g.logger.exception('Failed') AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'exception' Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 806, in <module> logging_setup() File "/home/ubuntu/log.py", line 41, in logging_setup sync_tensorboard=True) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wand b/__init__.py", line 980, in init _init_headless(run, False) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wand b/__init__.py", line 258, in _init_headless "W&B process failed to launch, see: {}".format(path)) wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.lo g Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 806, in <module> logging_setup() File "/home/ubuntu/log.py", line 41, in logging_setup sync_tensorboard=True) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wand b/__init__.py", line 980, in init _init_headless(run, False) File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_p36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wand b/__init__.py", line 258, in _init_headless "W&B process failed to launch, see: {}".format(path)) wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.lo g </denchmark-code>
it seems transient, rerunning again works

This one looks like it was blowing up in your training script: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 845, in <module> g.logger.exception('Failed') AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'exception' </denchmark-code>
Looks like g.logger can be Null sometimes. We should make stacktraces prettier because this looks like we caused it.

That's because you did cause it :) The stacktrace shows exception in wandb, my code intercepted this exception, and then crashed with its own error <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cybertronai/transformer-xl/blob/github-saturday/train.py#L836>https://github.com/cybertronai/transformer-xl/blob/github-saturday/train.py#L836</denchmark-link>
My guess was that this crash is connected to ~/.netrc containing someone else's credentials (different from WANDB_API_KEY), have not seen this since deleting this file. Will reopen if I see this again
Tried deleting ~/.netrc and logging back in. Still facing the same issue.
